Welcome to another week of organized chaos, bureaucratic magic, and statistical creativity.
If you thought the weekend would bring a breakâ€”cute. You must be new here.

ğŸ¢ GUYSUCO: THE GIFT THAT KEEPS ON NOT GIVING President Ali held “The Annual Disappointment Summit” with GuySuCo over the weekend, expressing “strong dissatisfaction” with their failure to meet 2025 targets.
In other news, water is wet.
ğŸ“Š GuySuCo Track Record:
2023 targets: âŒ Missed (weather!) 2024 targets: âŒ Missed (equipment!) 2025 targets: âŒ Missed (circumstances!) 2026 targets: â“ nervous laughter Success rate: 0% (but very consistent!)
The consequence for missing targets? Another stern meeting. Revolutionary.
Next time maybe a VERY stern meeting. Or an EXTREMELY stern meeting. The possibilities are endless!
At this rate, GuySuCo will hit targets when The Mohameds voluntarily board a planeâ€”which is to say, never.
â³ THE MOHAMEDS: PROFESSIONAL STAYERS Their lawyer said they’re “NOT going anywhere.” Turns out, 100% accurate. Give that man a Nobel Prize in Honesty.
Update: Extradition hearing adjourned to February 5th.
ğŸ“… The Mohamed Calendarâ„¢:
January: File 3 appeals, adjourn hearing
February: File 4 more appeals, adjourn again
March-December: See January-February, repeat with passion
Status: Still here, still filing, still making lawyers wealthy
Departure date: When GuySuCo meets targets (never)
US prosecutors asked to “bring forward” the hearing. Adorable. They must be new.
In Guyana’s legal system, “expedited” means “eventually,” “urgent” means “this decade,” and “NOT going anywhere” means exactly that.
What happens first:
Venus orbits the sun (224 days) A sloth finishes a marathon The Mohameds board a plane Spoiler: Venus.
ğŸ“‰ CRIME STATS: CREATIVE MATHEMATICS The Police Force dropped their 2025 report: Serious crimes down 25.5%! ğŸ‰
The fine print: Side effects include increased murders. Do not operate statistics while reading reality.
ğŸ“Š The ACTUAL Numbers:
Murders: UP 11% Road deaths: UP 6% (137 people) “Serious crimes”: Down 25.5%! ğŸ‰ Formula: Crime is down if you don’t count the crimes!
It’s like saying your diet’s amazing because you lost 5 poundsâ€”just don’t mention the 15 you gained first.
Things apparently NOT “serious crimes”:
Murder (up 11%) Vehicular manslaughter (up 6%) Filing 47 appeals to avoid extradition Things that ARE “serious crimes”:
Posting videos about gun licenses (see Stanley Basdeo below) The GPF expects celebration while murders are rising. It’s like celebrating the Titanic’s dry ballroom while the ship sank.
ğŸš¤ RIP GOLDEN GLOVES: 70 YEARS WASN’T ENOUGH After SEVENTY YEARS of service, Golden Gloves speedboat was shut down by the GRA for “irregularities.”
What existed in 1955:
Golden Gloves âœ… The Soviet Union âœ… Polio vaccine âœ… What doesn’t exist anymore:
All of the above âŒ ğŸ“Š Survival Guide:
What survives:
âœ… Mohamed legal defense (IMMORTAL) âœ… GuySuCo missing targets (ETERNAL) What doesn’t:
âŒ 70-year businesses (paperwork issues) âŒ Heroes Highway (25 months max) âŒ Opposition leadership (missing) Golden Gloves survived:
Independence, multiple governments, economic crises, the Cold War, Y2K, the ENTIRE Mohamed saga What killed it? Paperwork irregularities.
After 70 years, NOW is regulation time.
Meanwhile, The Mohameds have been “regularising” for years with 47 appeals. Nobody’s stopping THEM.
ğŸ’° STANLEY BASDEO: COMPLAINED TOO LOUDLY US businessman Stanley Basdeo posted a video about:
Difficulty getting gun licenses Bribery in Guyana Government’s response: CYBERCRIME CHARGES.
ğŸ“Š Legal Response Times:
Charging video complaint: âš¡ 24 hours
Extraditing actual criminals: ğŸŒ 847+ days
Fixing bribery he mentioned: ğŸ¤” File not found
The crime: Making a video about stuff everyone knows.
The punishment: $200,000 bail + surrendered passport.
For comparison:
The Mohameds: 47 appeals, still have passports Stanley: 1 video, passport confiscated The irony: He complained about bribery and now he’s in the legal system where… well, you get it.
Things you CAN do:
File infinite appeals âœ… Miss targets annually âœ… Things you CANNOT do:
Post videos about bribery âŒ Lesson: You can file 47 appeals (fine!), but you cannot post one (1) video about systemic issues (CYBERCRIME!).
ğŸ“… THE WEEK AHEAD Monday: Last week’s chaos was an aberration. (It wasn’t.)
Tuesday: “On track” update #848. Drinking game optional.
Wednesday: Mohamed appeal #48. Lawyer buys third vacation home.
Thursday: GuySuCo misses micro-target. Blames solar flares.
Friday: New timeline announced. Immediately obsolete.
Probability GuySuCo meets target: 0.1%
Probability Mohameds board plane: Cannot calculate impossibility
ğŸ“ THE BOTTOM LINE Another Monday of delays (sorry, “adjustments”), projects “firmly on track” (hopelessly behind), and crime stats that defy mathematics.
The pattern:
Work 70 years? Paperwork violation.
File appeals for 2+ years? Carry on!
Meet targets? What’s a target? â€”GuySuCo
Post videos? Cybercrime within 24 hours.
But hey, at least Costco toilet paper is coming (Feb 5). Given the amount of BS we wade through, we’ll need it.
Stay chaotic, Guyana. ğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡¾
P.S. - If complaints are cybercrime, this newsletter is toast. See you in court! (In 847 days, after 47 adjournments.)
